meanings.definition: An attempt to make something that is not the case appear true.
meanings.sent1: Her pretence of being sick fooled no one.
meanings.sent2: The magician's pretence of pulling a rabbit out of a hat amazed the audience.
meanings.sent3: His pretence of being a superhero made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The politician's pretence of caring for the people was transparent.
meanings.sent5: The child's pretence of being a doctor was adorable.

meanings.definition: A claim, especially a false or ambitious one.
meanings.sent1: The company's pretence of having the best product was quickly debunked.
meanings.sent2: His pretence of being a millionaire was shattered when his old car broke down.
meanings.sent3: The student's pretence of having finished all the homework was evident when the teacher asked for it.
meanings.sent4: Her pretence of being a famous actress was shattered when no one recognized her.
meanings.sent5: The cat's pretence of being a lion scared off the other animals.

meanings.definition: The act of pretending or feigning.
meanings.sent1: His pretence of being a tough guy faded when he started crying.
meanings.sent2: The children's pretence of being pirates led them on a grand adventure.
meanings.sent3: The dog's pretence of being a guard dog was ruined when it started licking the intruder.
meanings.sent4: Her pretence of being a chef was evident when she burnt the toast.
meanings.sent5: The actor's pretence of being a monster was so convincing it scared the audience.
